title: Groups, Identities and Helping Behaviour: Theory and Practice in the Social Psychology of Helping
abstractText: This Seminar Series grant brings together social psychologists working on group level approaches to helping behaviour with representatives of organisations involved in the practice of helping in emergencies. The objective of the seminar series will be to facilitate the exchange of ideas, expertise and resources between academics and practitioners and to shape the development of the group level perspective on the social psychology of helping. The seminars will be structured around keynote speeches from academics who are eminent in the field and attended by researchers and postgraduates from the UK and Europe. The agencies who attend will include Oxfam, Amnesty, the Home Office, the Civil Contingency Secretariate and many more. There will be two seminar venues, Lancaster University and St Andrews University. The first seminar will be held in September 07 and the second in June 08. The aim of the seminar series will be to develop closer working relations between academics and agencies and to facilitate the dissemination of academic research into practical work on helping and emergency intervention.
